text: [Music]
I'm Maya I'm a talent acquisition intern
right now I'm supporting different
recruiters with the different positions
that they're recruiting for and I'm used
as an additional resource to try all
different mechanisms that hopefully can
expand into the team and that they can
use across the next year as part of
their growth plan I definitely think
that within recruitment every day is
different and that is really exciting
because one day you'll be sourcing
another day you'll be talking to a
candidate about one role one big thing
that could be delivering results is
being able to present candidates with an
offer and with you know their dream job
and it really is a chance to change
people's lives
[Music]
I think being an intern at AWS is
different to other companies just
because you really do have the
opportunity to drive your own internship
and I do feel really fortunate that my
manager especially has always asked me
like what's next what should we do next
for you and sometimes I sort of freeze
I'm like oh I don't know like I don't
feel like I should have this much
Freedom or this much opportunity
you hear so many horror stories about
internships and there's such a stigma
that you're going to go into a company
and be the team coffee girl or something
similar but it really just isn't like
this at AWS I think my biggest takeaway
from my internship is going to sound
really cliche but it's true and it
really is that you can do whatever that
you want to do especially within AWS
because I work in such an supportive
team and supportive environment I really
do feel like I have the opportunity to
thrive and grow both personally and
professionally and I work with such
great people as well and it really has
made an internship worthwhile
